claim: GRI Standards define structured ESG disclosure requirements including governance structure, emissions accounting methodology, and assurance practices for evidence extraction patterns.
synthesized_finding: GRI Standards 2021 provide mandatory disclosure frameworks: GRI 2-9 (governance structure), GRI 305-1/2/3 (Scope 1/2/3 emissions), GRI 2-5 (external assurance). GRI Content Index enables traceability to specific disclosures.
note_on_relevance: GRI framework informs OSP theme (governance structure), GHG theme (emissions disclosure), and RD theme (reporting framework alignment) pattern matching

claim: TCFD framework structures climate risk disclosure across Governance, Strategy, Risk Management, and Metrics & Targets, providing stage indicators for RMM theme.
synthesized_finding: TCFD Recommendations require scenario analysis (1.5°C, 2°C pathways), physical/transition risk taxonomy, Scope 1/2/3 disclosure. TCFD alignment signals Stage 2+ maturity in Reporting & Disclosure theme. Widely adopted by SEC registrants.
note_on_relevance: TCFD informs RMM theme (climate risk taxonomy, scenario analysis), TSP theme (climate targets), and RD theme (framework alignment) evidence patterns

claim: ISSB S1/S2 establish baseline sustainability reporting standards with mandatory Scope 1/2 and encouraged Scope 3 disclosure, informing GHG and RD theme patterns.
synthesized_finding: ISSB S1 aligns with TCFD structure (Governance, Strategy, Risk, Metrics). S2 mandates Scope 1/2 emissions, encourages Scope 3. ISSB adoption signals Stage 2-3 maturity. Expected global regulatory adoption by 2025-2026.
note_on_relevance: ISSB informs RD theme (framework alignment, ISSB adoption as Stage 2-3 indicator), GHG theme (Scope 1/2/3 disclosure requirements), and TSP theme (metrics and targets)

claim: SBTi validates corporate climate targets against 1.5°C science, providing strong Stage 3-4 indicators for TSP theme.
synthesized_finding: SBTi Corporate Net-Zero Standard requires near-term (5-10 year) and long-term (2050) targets covering Scope 1/2/3. SBTi 'committed' status indicates Stage 3, 'approved/validated' indicates Stage 4. Third-party validation confirms target ambition and methodology.
note_on_relevance: SBTi status is primary TSP theme evidence: 'committed'=Stage 3, 'validated'=Stage 4. Also informs GHG theme (Scope 1/2/3 coverage requirements) and TSP target validation logic

claim: GHG Protocol defines Scope 1/2/3 emissions accounting methodology, establishing classification framework for GHG theme evidence extraction.
synthesized_finding: GHG Protocol Corporate Standard defines Scope 1 (direct), Scope 2 (purchased energy), Scope 3 (value chain, 15 categories). Establishes calculation, reporting, verification methodology. De facto standard for corporate emissions accounting. Requires base year and recalculation policy disclosure.
note_on_relevance: GHG Protocol compliance indicates Stage 2-4 maturity in GHG theme. Informs pattern matching for Scope 1/2/3 emissions values, methodology references, base year identification, and assurance scope

claim: Firms with high ESG maturity exhibit formalized governance structures, board-level oversight, and integrated KPI systems, informing OSP theme stage indicators.
synthesized_finding: Empirical study finds high-maturity firms characterized by C-suite ESG roles (CSO), cross-functional committees, external assurance. Board-level committees indicate Stage 3+ governance. Integrated KPI systems differentiate Stage 3-4 from Stage 1-2.
note_on_relevance: Validates OSP theme stage indicators: C-suite roles=Stage 3-4, board committees=Stage 3+, integrated KPIs=Stage 3-4. Informs pattern matching for governance structure and role titles

claim: External assurance of sustainability reports significantly improves disclosure quality, with limited vs. reasonable assurance differentiating Stage 3 vs. Stage 4 maturity.
synthesized_finding: Study finds external assurance improves data reliability. Limited assurance (moderate confidence) signals Stage 3. Reasonable assurance (equivalent to financial audit) signals Stage 4. Big 4 providers (Deloitte, EY, KPMG, PwC) indicate higher quality.
note_on_relevance: Informs RD theme stage classification: limited assurance=Stage 3, reasonable assurance=Stage 4. Validates assurance level as key differentiator. Guides pattern matching for assurance provider names and assurance scope

claim: SEC 10-K filings follow standardized structure with ESG disclosures typically in Item 1 (Business), Item 1A (Risk Factors), Item 7 (MD&A), informing filing parser logic.
synthesized_finding: SEC 10-K structure: Item 1 (Business operations, ESG practices), Item 1A (Risk Factors, climate risks), Item 7 (MD&A, forward-looking targets). 20-F (foreign issuers) has similar structure. Dedicated ESG sections increasingly common.
note_on_relevance: Guides filing parser section extraction strategy. Item 1A relevant for RMM theme (climate risks), Item 1 for OSP/DM/EI themes (operations), Item 7 for TSP/RMM (targets, scenario analysis)

claim: BeautifulSoup4 provides robust HTML parsing for extracting structured text from SEC EDGAR filings despite inconsistent HTML structure.
synthesized_finding: BeautifulSoup handles malformed HTML gracefully (common in SEC filings). find_all() enables section extraction, get_text() preserves paragraph structure. Performance sufficient: parse 200-page filing in ~2-5 seconds.
note_on_relevance: Validates choice of BeautifulSoup4 for filing parser (ADR-004). Confirms performance is adequate for batch processing (<45s per filing target). Informs error handling strategy for malformed HTML

claim: Transformer models enable contextual text understanding for NLP, but regex pattern matching is 10-100× faster with sufficient precision for PoC.
synthesized_finding: BERT and transformers provide contextual understanding for named entity recognition, semantic similarity. Higher precision than regex, but 10-100× computational cost. Out of scope for Task 008 v1, but candidate for Task 009 ML enhancements.
note_on_relevance: Validates ADR-001 decision (regex for v1, ML for future). Documents trade-off: regex achieves 75-85% precision with 10-100× speed advantage. Informs future enhancement roadmap (Task 009)
